title.narrative: HIV/AIDS PREVENTION,TREATMENT & CARE

description.narrative: The Government has improved capacity to provide equitable and quality HIV/AIDS prevention, treatment, care and support services for women and children by 2018., which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4.0 Improved and equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions by children, pregnant women and adolescents

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
HIV testing including self testing and counselling in adolescents
Social protection measures in support of HIV-AIDS prevention

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government has improved capacity to provide equitable and quality HIV/AIDS prevention, treatment, care and support services forwomen and children by 2018.

description.narrative: HIV positivity rate of the exposed children aged 0-14 decreased to 10 percent (from 15.3 percent in 2018) with enhanced integrated mentoring and supportive supervision to improve capacity of 370 service providers in 207 facilities on the Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT), Early Infant Diagnosis and Paediatric Anti-retroviral Therapy. About 6,800 children and adolescents were tested through the community-based index case family testing, and those tested positive were referred to health facilities for confirmation and enrolment to appropriate and equitable care and support, while additional 300 most vulnerable children benefited from psychological counselling, recreational activities, and educational tour. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
